<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mask Familiar](/Feats.aspx?ID=1103) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=12) pg. 101 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Magaambyan Attendant](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=29)

**Prerequisites**
[Magaambyan Attendant Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1102)

</column>

---

Your mask takes on a personality of its own, allowing it to serve as your [familiar](/familiar-abilities). Though you can still wear it as a mask, you can detach it from your face to grant it a bodily form of colored light that allows it to move around; usually, this is a miniature form of the animal the mask represents. Detaching or reattaching the familiar to transform it is a two-action activity. Even in mask form, the familiar can move around on its master’s face and speaks in a distinct voice (if it can talk). It is easily recognized as more than a simple mask unless the familiar succeeds at a [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) check to [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) a mask. Other than its appearance and the fact that it can be worn, it functions as other familiars. Your mask familiar has access to the mask freeze familiar ability

**Mask Freeze**: When in mask form, your familiar can hide its obvious supernatural qualities to pass as a simple, unassuming mask. It doesn’t need to Impersonate to fool a passing glance, and it gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its Deception DC against an active observer [Seeking](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) or otherwise studying it.

<title level="2">Mask Familiar leads to...</title>
[Adaptive Mask Familiar](/Feats.aspx?ID=1104)
name: Mask Familiar
